member.name: M:Catel.Data.DataObjectBase.InitializeCustomProperties
member.summary:
Allows the initialization of custom properties. This is a virtual method that is called inside the constructor before the object is fully constructed.
This might be considered as bad or as a hack, but it's a good way to be able to inject custom properties before any actual logic is handled by derived classes.
member.remarks: Only use when you really know what you are doing.

member.name: P:Catel.Data.DataObjectBase.HideValidationResults
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the validation results should be hidden. This means that the should be filled, but the and should not expose any of the validation ressults.
This is very useful when the validation in the UI should be delayed to a specific point. However, the validation is still available for retrieval.
By default, this value is false.
member.value: true if the validation should be hidden; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Unlike the property, this property will not prevent validation. It will only prevent the error interfaces to not expose them.

member.name: T:Catel.DynamicEventListener
member.summary: Dynamic event listener which enables the subscription to events where the type of the handler is unknown. This class uses the ILGenerator to create the dynamic methods.
member.remarks:
Some parts in this class (with the instances and increments), but this is required to dynamically subscribe to an even that we do not know the handler of on forehand. Normally, you would do this via an anynomous delegate, but that doesn't work so the event delegate is created via ILGenerator at runtime.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8122085/calling-an-instance-method-when-event-occurs/8122242#8122242.

member.name: F:Catel.DynamicEventListener.Log
member.summary: The log.

member.name: F:Catel.DynamicEventListener.Instances
member.summary: Gets the list of instances of the window. Required to make a call to a specific instance because Silverlight doesn't allow us to add a method to this class via ILGenerator.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The instance that contains the event.
Name of the event, must be a publicly accessible event.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The instance that contains the event.

The instance that contains the handler.
Name of the handler, must be a publicly accessible method without any parameters.

member.name: T:Catel.NotSupportedInSilverlightException
member.summary:
Exception in case the functionality is not supported in Silverlight.
Unfortunately, Silverlight misses a lot of functionality. When a feature is not supported in Catel, this is because the .NET Framework (or actually Silverlight) does not allow the code to handle that specific feature.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Catel.NotSupportedInSilverlightException.Reason
member.summary: Get the reason why the feature is not supported.
member.value: The reason why the feature is missing.

member.name: T:Catel.NotSupportedInWindowsPhone7Exception
member.summary:
Exception in case the functionality is not supported in Windows Phone 7.
Unfortunately, Windows Phone 7 misses a lot of functionality. When a feature is not supported in Catel, this is because the .NET Framework (or actually Windows Phone 7) does not allow the code to handle that specific feature.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.value: The reason why the feature is missing.

member.name: T:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator
member.summary:
The service locator which is used to retrieve the right instances of services.
The cool thing about this service locator is that it can use external containers (from example from Unity) to resolve types if the types are not registered in the container itself. To do this, use the following code:
var serviceLocator = ServiceLocator.Instance; serviceLocator.RegisterExternalContainer(myUnityContainer);
The service locator will use the external containers in case the current container does not contain the type. If the external containers also don't contain the type, there is one last way to resolve the type using the event. The event passes that contains the type the service locator is looking for. By setting the or in the handler, the service locator will resolve the type.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified service type is registered.
member.returns: true if the specified service type is registered; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Note that the actual implementation lays in the hands of the IoC technique being used.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified external container is supported by this .

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.RegisterExternalContainer(System.Object)
member.summary:
Registers an external container. This can be an external IoC container such as a Unity container.
Registering an external container in the service locator is very useful in case types are already registered in another container (in case of Prism, for example).
The will use the external container to resolve unregistered types.
Use the to check whether an external container is registered before registering it (otherwise this method will thrown an exception).

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.RegisterExternalContainerHelper(Catel.IoC.IExternalContainerHelper)
member.summary:
Registers an implementation of the class.
This method can be used to add support for new external IoC containers.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.ExportInstancesToExternalContainers
member.summary:
Exports all the current instances of the services to the external containers. This means that non-instantiated services will not be exported.
This method will only export services if the services are not already registered with the external container.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.ExportToExternalContainers
member.summary:
Exports all services to external containers. If a service is not yet instantiated, the instance will be registered with the external container. Otherwise, the type will be registered.
This method will only export services if the services are not already registered with the external container.

member.name: P:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.AutomaticallyKeepContainersSynchronized
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the service locator should keep the external containers in sync with the current .
This means that after every call to one of the following methods:
*
*
*
*
*
this class will automatically invoke the method.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the service locator should keep all containers synchronized; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.SupportDependencyInjection
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether this service locator supports dependency inject.
If this property is true, the service locator will try to instantiate the object with all constructors, starting with the one with the most parameters.
If a constructor fails, the service locator will try the constructor with less parameters until the type is either constructed successfully or all constructors are tried.
If this property is false, it will only use to instantiate the service.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the service locator should support dependency injection; otherwise, false.

member.name: E:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.MissingType
member.summary:
Occurs when a type cannot be resolved the by service locator. It first tries to raise this event.
If there are no handlers or no handler can fill up the missing type, an exception will be thrown by the service locator.

member.remarks: Note that the actual implementation lays in the hands of the IoC technique being used.
member.exception: The type is not found in any container.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.IsExternalContainerSupported(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified external container is supported by this .
member.returns: true if the external container type is supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.RegisterExternalContainer(System.Object)
member.summary:
Registers an external container. This can be an external IoC container such as a Unity container.
Registering an external container in the service locator is very useful in case types are already registered in another container (in case of Prism, for example).
The will use the external container to resolve unregistered types.
Use the to check whether an external container is registered before registering it (otherwise this method will thrown an exception).

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.RegisterExternalContainerHelper(Catel.IoC.IExternalContainerHelper)
member.summary:
Registers an implementation of the class.
This method can be used to add support for new external IoC containers.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.ExportInstancesToExternalContainers
member.summary:
Exports all the current instances of the services to the external containers. This means that non-instantiated services will not be exported.
This method will only export services if the services are not already registered with the external container.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.ExportToExternalContainers
member.summary:
Exports all services to external containers. If a service is not yet instantiated, the instance will be registered with the external container. Otherwise, the type will be registered.
This method will only export services if the services are not already registered with the external container.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.RegisterInstance(System.Type,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Registers a specific instance of an service.
member.param: The original container where the instance was found in.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.RegisterType(System.Type,System.Type,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Object)
member.summary: Registers the specific implementing type for the service type.
member.param: if set to true, an older type registration is overwritten by this new one.

If set to true, when the container tries to resolve the type always return the same instance otherwise a new one will be created. If is
false
and the type is already registered then this parameter will be ignored.
The original container where the type was found in.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.ResolveTypeFromKnownContainer(System.Type)
member.summary: Resolves the type from a known container.
member.returns: An instance of the type registered on the service.
member.exception: The type is not found in any container.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.ResolveTypeFromUnknownContainer(System.Type)
member.summary: Resolves the type from an unknown container.
member.returns: An instance of the type registered on the service.
member.exception: The type is not found in any container.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.CreateInstanceOfAllRegisteredTypes
member.summary:
Creates an instance of all registered types. This method is required in case an does not support the registration of types without instantiating them.
This method only creates instances of types that are not yet instantiated.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.GetContainerHelperForContainer(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the container helper for the container.
member.returns: The container helper or null if the container is not supported.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.CreateServiceInstance(System.Type)
member.summary: Creates the service instance.
member.param: Type of the service to instantiate.
member.returns: The service instance.

member.name: P:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.Instance
member.summary: Gets the instance of the default service locator. This property serves as as singleton.

member.name: P:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.AutomaticallyKeepContainersSynchronized
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the service locator should keep the external containers in sync with the current .
This means that after every call to one of the following methods:
*
*
*
*
*
this class will automatically invoke the method.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the service locator should keep all containers synchronized; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.SupportDependencyInjection
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether this service locator supports dependency inject.
If this property is true, the service locator will try to instantiate the object with all constructors, starting with the one with the most parameters.
If a constructor fails, the service locator will try the constructor with less parameters until the type is either constructed successfully or all constructors are tried.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the service locator should support dependency injection; otherwise, false.

member.name: E:Catel.IoC.ServiceLocator.MissingType
member.summary:
Occurs when a type cannot be resolved the by service locator. It first tries to raise this event.
If there are no handlers or no handler can fill up the missing type, an exception will be thrown by the service locator.

member.summary:
Returns a relative path string from a full path.
The path to convert. Can be either a file or a directory The base path to truncate to and replace
Lower case string of the relative path. If path is a directory it's returned without a backslash at the end.
Examples of returned values: .\test.txt, ..\test.txt, ..\..\..\test.txt, ., ..
member.param: Full path to convert to relative path.
The base path (a.k.a. working directory). If this parameter is null or empty, the current working directory will be used.

member.name: T:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator
member.summary:
The interface definition for our Message mediator. This allows loose-event coupling between components in an application by sending messages to registered elements.
This class implements the mediator pattern.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.Register``1(System.Object,System.Action{``0},System.Object)
member.summary: Registers a specific recipient for a specific message.
member.returns: true if the handler is registered successfully; otherwise false.
member.remarks: A handler cannot be registered twice. If the same handler is already registered, this method will return false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.Unregister``1(System.Object,System.Action{``0},System.Object)
member.summary: Unregisters a specific recipient for a specific message with the specified tag.
member.returns: true if the handler is unregistered successfully; otherwise false.
member.remarks: A handler cannot be unregistered when it is not registered first. If a handler is unregistered while it is not registered, this method will return false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.UnregisterRecipient(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Unregisters a specific recipient for all the (non-static) message the recipient is subscribed to.
member.returns: true if the handler is unregistered successfully; otherwise false.
member.remarks: A handler cannot be unregistered when it is not registered first. If a handler is unregistered while it is not registered, this method will return false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.UnregisterRecipientAndIgnoreTags(System.Object)
member.summary:
Unregisters a specific recipient for all the (non-static) message the recipient is subscribed to.
This method ignores any tags. If a message recipient matches the specified recipient, it is unsubscribed.
member.returns: true if the handler is unregistered successfully; otherwise false.
member.remarks: A handler cannot be unregistered when it is not registered first. If a handler is unregistered while it is not registered, this method will return false.

member.summary: Broadcasts a message to all message targets for a given message tag and passes a parameter.
member.returns: true if any handlers were invoked; otherwise false.

member.summary:
Cleans up the list of registered handlers. All handlers that are no longer alive are removed from the list.
This method is automatically invoked after each call to , but can also be invoked manually.

member.name: T:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2
member.summary:
Base class for messages distributed via the Catel MessageMediator subsystem. Inherit from this class to define individual message types.
For most subclasses the only thing to code is an empty class body including the type parameters.
For the payload data you can choose betweeen the following options:
The Data property provided within this base class of type TData using simple types like int or string.
The Data property provided within this base class of type TData using userdefined data types.
Define properties on the derived message class itself.
A combination of the previous options.
member.typeparam: The actual type of the message.
The type of payload data to be carried with the message.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Neccesary for two reasons:
Create an instance of the Message class via the TMessage type parameter used by the With() method.
Allow derived classes to be defined using an empty class body with the implicit default constructor.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Use MessageClass.SendWith(data) to send a new message via the mediator service.
member.param: The optional Catel mediator tag to be used.

member.summary: Send the message.
member.param: The optional Catel mediator tag to be used.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2.Register(System.Object,System.Action{`0},System.Object)
member.summary:
Convenient helper method to subscribe to this Message type.
Usage:
MessageClass.Register(this, msg => Handler) if the handler has the signature void Handler(MessageClass message)
MessageClass.Register(this, msg => Handler(msg.Data)) if the handler has the signature void Handler(TData data)
member.param: The instance which registers to the messages. Is most cases this will be this.
A delegate handling the incoming message. For example: msg => Handler(msg.Data).
The optional Catel mediator tag to be used.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.MessageBase`2.Unregister(System.Object,System.Action{`0},System.Object)
member.summary:
Convenient helper method to unsubscribe from this Message type.
Usage:
MessageClass.Register(this, msg => Handler) if the handler has the signature void Handler(MessageClass message)
MessageClass.Register(this, msg => Handler(msg.Data)) if the handler has the signature void Handler(TData data)
member.param: The instance which unregisters from the messages. Is most cases this will be this.
A delegate handling the incoming message. For example: msg => Handler(msg.Data).
The optional Catel mediator tag to be used.

member.summary:
Returns an instance of the MessageClass populated with payload Data.
Most times used internally by the method.
member.returns: An instance of the MessageClass populated with the given payload data.

member.summary:

member.returns: The array of successfully loaded types.

Initializes the types in Silverlight. It does this by looping through all loaded assemblies and registering the type by type name and assembly name.

member.name: M:Catel.Reflection.TypeHelper.GetAssemblyNameWithoutOverhead(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the assembly name without overhead (version, public keytoken, etc)
member.param: Name of the fully qualified assembly.
member.returns: The assembly without the overhead.

member.name: M:Catel.Reflection.TypeHelper.GetAssemblyName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the name of the assembly.
member.param: Full name of the type, for example Catel.TypeHelper, Catel.Core.
member.returns: The assembly name retrieved from the type, for example Catel.Core or null if the assembly is not contained by the type.

member.name: M:Catel.Reflection.TypeHelper.GetTypeNameWithAssembly(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the type name with assembly, but without the fully qualified assembly name. For example, this method provides the string:
Catel.TypeHelper, Catel.Core, Version=1.0.0.0, PublicKeyToken=123456789
and will return:
Catel.TypeHelper, Catel.Core
member.returns: The type name including the assembly.

member.name: M:Catel.Reflection.TypeHelper.GetTypeName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the name of the type without the assembly but including the namespace.
member.param: Full name of the type, for example Catel.TypeHelper, Catel.Core.
member.returns: The type name retrieved from the type, for example Catel.TypeHelper.

member.name: M:Catel.Reflection.TypeHelper.GetTypeNameWithoutNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the type name without the assembly namespace.
member.param: Full name of the type, for example Catel.TypeHelper, Catel.Core.
member.returns: The type name retrieved from the type, for example TypeHelper.

member.name: M:Catel.Reflection.TypeHelper.GetTypeNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the type namespace.
member.param: Full name of the type, for example Catel.TypeHelper, Catel.Core.
member.returns: The type namespace retrieved from the type, for example Catel.

member.summary: Returns a filtered array of objects of the specified member type.

The delegate that does the comparisons, returning true if the member currently being inspected matches the and false otherwise. You can use the FilterAttribute, FilterName, and FilterNameIgnoreCase delegates supplied by this class. The first uses the fields of FieldAttributes, MethodAttributes, and MethodImplAttributes as search criteria, and the other two delegates use String objects as the search criteria.

The search criteria that determines whether a member is returned in the array of MemberInfo objects. The fields of FieldAttributes, MethodAttributes, and MethodImplAttributes can be used in conjunction with the FilterAttribute delegate supplied by this class.

member.summary: Provides a syncronization context to acquire or release exclusive lock of an object and execute thread safe code.

member.summary: The sync obj.

member.name: M:Catel.Threading.SynchronizationContext.Execute(System.Action)
member.summary: This method execute the into a exclusive lock.
member.remarks: If the lock is acquired before call this method, then the execution is delayed until the lock would released.

member.name: M:Catel.Threading.SynchronizationContext.Enqueue(System.Action,System.ComponentModel.RunWorkerCompletedEventHandler)
member.summary: This method enqueue the execution of the into a exclusive lock.
member.remarks: If the lock is acquired before call this method, then the execution is delayed until the lock would released, without blocking the current thread. This method relay the execution of the code into an instance of .
member.param: Method that will handle the RunWorkerCompleted event of a class. It occurs when the background operation has completed, has been canceled, or has raised an exception.

member.name: M:Catel.Threading.SynchronizationContext.Enqueue``1(System.Func{``0},System.ComponentModel.RunWorkerCompletedEventHandler)
member.summary: This method execute the into a exclusive lock and returns a value.
member.remarks: If the lock is acquired before call this method, then the execution is delayed until the lock would released, blocking the current thread. This method relay the execution of the code into an instance of .
member.param: Method that will handle the RunWorkerCompleted event of a class. It occurs when the background operation has completed, has been canceled, or has raised an exception.

member.name: M:Catel.Threading.SynchronizationContext.Execute``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: This method execute the into a exclusive lock and returns a value.
member.remarks: If the lock is acquired before call this method, then the execution is delayed until the lock would released, blocking the current thread.
member.returns: The result of execute the code.
